intro: Spermacoce andongensis, commonly known as the Andong morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of morning glories. The plant produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and sprawling. Spermacoce andongensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
